text: Hi folks, when typing `using MyDevPackage` , does Julia load the latest version of this package, or does it keep the version from the time that I added in through the package manager? Thank you

elements.text: , does Julia load the latest version of this package, or does it keep the version from the time that I added in through the package manager? Thank you

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
And when, I stage & commit through _git_, shouldn't the latest changes be available without re-adding the package?

elements.text: And when, I stage & commit through
, shouldn't the latest changes be available without re-adding the package?

text: You can track a branch (e.g. `]add MyDevPackage#main`) and use `]up MyDevPackage` to get the latest commit

I tried this, but still I am getting a slightly older status every time.
First  modified, the source code, staged the changes, commited them, then `]up MyDevPackage`...and `using MyDevPackage`

elements.text:
I tried this, but still I am getting a slightly older status every time.
First  modified, the source code, staged the changes, commited them, then

text: The commit must be pushed upstream first for Pkg to pull from the branch. If you’re developing locally, it is recommended to use Revise to automatically update code without updating packages.

elements.text: The commit must be pushed upstream first for Pkg to pull from the branch. If you’re developing locally, it is recommended to use Revise to automatically update code without updating packages.

text:
Thanks
Yes I am developing locally. So unless I use Revise.j I have to  push the code from my local package  up to Github and pull it back down again?

elements.text:
Thanks
Yes I am developing locally. So unless I use Revise.j I have to  push the code from my local package  up to Github and pull it back down again?

text: After you push the new commits, do `]up MyPackage` and Pkg will take care of the rest. You don’t need to manually git pull.

and Pkg will take care of the rest. You don’t need to manually git pull.
